title: Riot, can you just admit you dun goofed re: Ryze?
body:
This is the 3rd time in a row you've given soft reworks to a classic mage- Ryze has followed Zilean and Veigar. And all three changes have been RUBBISH, taking champion who were previously niche/situational/undertuned and just making them garbage. Ryze hurts particularly badly because he was once effectively the game's _poster boy_ (alongside Katarina) but now his win rate has plummeted to less than _40%!_

Riot, this is not working. These "reworks" are COMPLETELY failing in their stated objective of making the champions less binary because they're simply _killing the champions dead._ This is _not_ something you an just shrug your shoulders about and say "eh, we'll give them some tuneups as we go". These high-profile fuck-ups should be your TOP priority at the moment.

So why does he know have the lowest win rate in the game by a MILE? You can't just write it off as "people are still getting used to him", it's already been almost a month!

Two reasons:

1. People really still are learning this champ. Lots of people have no idea how to control his passive, and it takes some time to get comfortable with his combo, even if you know how it is supposed to work. On top of that, nobody knows for sure what the optimal build / runes / masteries are right now.

2. His laning phase is weak. His kill pressure is super low, because until level 11ish, he just lacks the damage to kill anyone during his super state. He can't finish you in 3 to 4 seconds, and then his damage drops off really hard. They're actually buffing the duration of his super mode in the next patch to 6 seconds at all ranks, which will finally give him some kill pressure in lane. Might need more though.

How many months was it after Zed's release before people realized he was OP?
I think it was 3 iirc.

Zed becoming good (along with other AD assassins) had nothing to do with champion changes.  It was 100% the item/penetration reworks of S3 or S4 (can't remember which it was off the top of my mind) that made them good/abusive.  Before then itemization for AD assassins was so bad as to be a joke.

Zed was released in S3.
Penetration changes were in the S2-S3 preseason.

Zed was released 11 months after those changes. The changes in the game after Zed were the support/jungle changes.

Zed wasn't released in season 3. He was released exactly at the end of season 2, in [v1.0.0.151.](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/V1.0.0.151) That literally was the last patch of season 2. The next patch, [v1.0.0.152](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/V1.0.0.152), was the beginning of the season 3 preseason. This was the patch where we saw the introduction of better AD caster itemization options and the penetration reworks.

Zed wasn't released 11 months after the penetration changes. He was released about a month before them.
LoLwiki's syntax OP. I thought it said 2013.
Fair enough. Misunderstandings happen. Can't fault you for that.

Zed was released near the end of season 2, when AD casters in general suffered from poor itemization. The item reworks and the changes to the penetration formula at the beginning of preseason 3 gave him a significant boost. All AD casters were played at the time because Black Cleaver was OP (you may remember the League of Cleavers). Zed's playrate shot up, and he continued to be played after it was nerfed and the League of Cleavers ended.

Even if Zed was a good example of people being wrong about a champion's balance (Yasuo would work much better as an example, because people were really wrong about him on release), I still don't think it would be a good argument. Just because people were wrong about champions being weak in the past doesn't mean they are wrong now, particularly since there have been plenty of examples of people being right that champions were weak. This argument just doesn't sway me. Ryze seems weak and he's not showing the signs of improvement I'd expect if he was just misunderstood.

I'm not disagreeing that he's weak, but I really do think he's still being played poorly. Another way to put it would be, if you're having trouble with Ryze, that doesn't mean you're bad. But overall, Ryze players right now are way less experienced with him than let's say, Rumble players are with their champion, and that means Ryze's statistics are going to suffer.

Even though he's been out for month, I've seen so many people saying "it's so hard to use your passive, I have to get to four stacks and then the enemy just stays away from me". Well don't wait til four stacks to engage then! Or people who don't know that his 5th stack cast resets cooldowns. Or people trying out experimental build / skill orders, some of which may be better than what's traditional but many of which are probably worse.

Basically, because he was weak on release, few people are playing him, and that means no conventional wisdom has formed about how to play him right. So people are still out there, experimenting and flailing around trying to figure him out.

Ryze definitely needs buffs, but he also needs new champion specific game knowledge that isn't common yet. Hopefully they keep buffing him until he's actually good again, and people come back to play him instead of giving up on him.

Maxing Q is bad because all it offers the least out of all of your spells until lategame. E is a better spell if only one target is next to the initial, and W is better per point because the duration and damage go up. (What do you mean max E wtf its a rng spell). No, it's not. That was reworked. E will currently hit the initial target, then bounce to up to 6 targets near the initial. Now, here is where this spell gets REALLY powerful. After hitting the secondary targets, all 6 shots will bounce BACK to the initial target, dealing even more damage per shot. Meaning landing an E on an enemy in a full minion wave will ensure they take at least 250-ish damage from E alone, plus the burst from W.

If you play right, you should easily be able to out sustain and out poke lane opponents whom do not directly counter you.


Maxing Q does not reduce the cooldown, increases the cost, and only gives 100 damage at rank 5, plus .5 mana scaling, compared to his E which gives 5X that amount if you land it in a full minion wave (which is stupid easy in lane).

Ryze is deceptively strong right now, and his only real problem is how bad his passive is until you get 2 points into ult.

You see the passive only lasts 3 seconds, but goes up for 1 second for every point into your ult. You ult also gives cdr, which makes your passive even more effective. The passive is being buffed to last for 6 seconds flat starting at level 1, meaning ryze will actually have a midgame compared to right now, where he HAS to farm until level 11. With this change, he should be able to start making plays at around level 8-9. 

Now, laning on him is really easy and safe, you have zero reason to be losing trades if you play them right. You probably won't get any kills, as ryze lacks all in kill pressure early game. Sure, if you go all in at the right time you will send them running, but you will not be getting a kill unless they get greedy or where already low. Start Sapphire, Max E, then W, then Q. Back when you have enough gold for a tear. TP back to lane. Focus on farm. Whenever it is safe to do so, poke. Simply use your W while the enemy is standing in their minion wave, then E them. Watch as half their health bar disappears and they can't do anything about it other than stay away from their minions, meaning they cant farm unless they are ranged.

Now, Ryze will get shit on by champs such as irelia, because with how her kit works she can stun you when your passive procs, and then out sustain your weak damage afterwards (Her stun is 2 seconds, your passive at this point is 3. Big issue for your dps). He can also struggle against ranged champs, as catching them in a minion wave can be very hard.

But seriously, do not max Q. It is asking to get stomped in lane. His Q is a lategame spell right now. It does no damage early even when maxed, and is really just an awful lane spell in general.

E offers far more damage, and W offers far more utility. So, to answer your question, yes, one of the problems is you people suck shit at reworked ryze.

Firstly, the Ryze rework was done by the rework team, the other two by the live balance team.

The goals of the Veigar and Zilean reworks had nothing to do with their gameplay being binary. Veigar had a bullshit stun and Zilean had little counterplay beyond "Stay out of my range" in lane. Heck, he was 90% Pick-ban at worlds, wasn't he?

Secondly, Riot said they were looking into buffs for the PBE patch cycle 5.10. I think that means they will be out in 5.11 (but don't hold me or them to that!)

Thirdly, Veigar is sort of okay at the moment...

Rather than complaining, suggest changes to these champions that won't just bring the problems back - that means no AOE instant stun cage on Veigar, and you must keep some form of counterplay to ZIlean in lane.

>Secondly, Riot said they were looking into buffs for the PBE patch cycle 5.10.

They're on the PBE. They're pretty small, and aren't going to fix him by themselves. He'll still be bad. They're the first changes after the rework, so they aren't going to be the ones to fix him. Same way it worked for Zilean and Veigar, funnily enough. It's been a few patches since the last Zilean buffs, but he's not getting any buffs next patch. Same for Veigar.

>Thirdly, Veigar is sort of okay at the moment...

Strong, comforting statement right there. Makes me feel a lot better about him.

>Rather than complaining, suggest changes to these champions that won't just bring the problems back

For Veigar and Zilean, the solution is either going to be number buffs, which may work for Veigar but isn't going to create interesting gameplay for Zilean, or a more complete rework. They got into this problem because they only tried to rework the problematic elements of the kits without trying to modify the unsatisfying parts of the kits.

There is no reason why Zilean should have kept his terrible and boring passive through a rework. Replacing that should have been just as high a priority as changing his bombs. There are plenty of options for increasing his power if that isn't enough. They could afford to look into a new W and put a charge mechanic on his Q and/or lower the E CD, since that is pretty much what it functions as now that it no longer interacts with his ultimate. They could revert the E changes to give him some power back. They could buff his ultimate through a higher duration or lower cooldown. There are options, but Riot is being too cautious with their buffs. There is no reason for them to be waiting 5 or more patches to buff him when he's so bad.

> [{quoted}](name=qetzel,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QLAkXIqo,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-23T09:29:08.671+0000)

I suggested 2 ideas to fix Veigar- the big fix and the small fix:

The big fix was actually to completely replace Dark Matter, since that's the real reason losing the instant stun hurt him so badly- it's about 1/3 of his total damage in his combo, but it's LITERALLY completely impossible to land on a target that isn't CCd unless you lead it so heavily that they'd have to be completely oblivious to walk into it (admittedly quite a lot of players do). The real problem with Veigar isn't that he can't land his stun, it's that the REST of his kit is structured so that if he can't land his stun he does nothing.

The small fix was just to lift an idea from Smite- the Cripple CC, which doesn't actually inhibit movement the way a slow or root does, it just prevents all dashes, jumps and blinks. Basically make Event Horizon Cripple all units within it so they can still run around inside the cage to dodge his skillshots but can't dash or flash out of it (after all, what is an Event Horizon but the edge of _a black hole?_). This way he doesn't HAVE to land an instant stun with the edge of the cage and can actually use it the way it was intended.

I also suggested a fix for Zilean- rather than him only getting a double bomb detonation if he can land both bombs on a single target (which is almost impossible with the ridiculously finicky target selection mechanics the skill currently has) the 2nd bomb should detonate if it's struck by the explosion of the first one, with the stun only affecting units struck by both explosions.

As for Ryze, though, I got nothing.

For Ryze I think he just needs some number buffs. He feels as though he could be strong but is just undertuned.

Veigar... I don't know... I think the more recent changes have put him into an alright state. Yes, having W hard/reallyhard/reallyreallyhard to hit isn't good, but even so, he is strong. A change to W would undoubtedly require compensation nerfs.
For evidence   http://champion.gg/champion/Veigar/Middle

Your Zilean idea is interesting. Do you mean "in the explosion range" or "in the explosion". If you mean "Explosion range" it may be a little bit strong - that explosion range isn't small! If you mean "in the explosion" then that needs good timing. It would give Zilean a way to show more mechanical skill with a reward.

How would you respond to just reliability buffs. Better target selection or a slightly larger bomb detection radius?

I mean "in the explosion"- the explosion of the 1st bomb sets off the 2nd one. Of course, the 2nd one would have to have been out for at least 1 second to "prime" it before the 1st one goes off or it won't trigger- this is to prevent abusive cases of Zil throwing 1 bomb and Rewinding, then waiting until just before it explodes to throw the 2nd one into its blast radius for an instant stun. That way if he tags 2 different units with 2 bombs they'll both be stunned if they can't move away from each other in time, but they do _have_ time to at least react.

Reliability buffs would be a start, though.
Honestly Ryze's new state isn't bad. The new attack animation and passive are definitely a step forward. He's just kinda clunky with the new Q being so pathetic.
Yea, its really an underwhelming ability. "its now a poke" is an understatement, as it barely tickles.

I actually like the new Veigar after they buffed his stun again. But I agree with Zilean and Ryze. They just seem to have no impact in their games

I got Triumphant Ryze skin.

Now I wanna actually be able to play the champion without being called a troll.

To be honest, I really like the Ryze rework, the skillshot isn't too hard to hit, the E hits like a truck and he just feels powerful without being complicated. I think he just needs some small buffs and for more people to try him out with other lanes and builds.

Ryze definitely needs a buff. He's so weak now that even when he triggers his passive, most melee champs still simply rape him. During the early game, he can't even poke with his Q because it's easy to stay behind minions. All you have are W and E that cost a shitload of mana for the damage it deals. The old Ryze used to be really good against melees (probably too good, which is why his Q got reworked) but the current ryze sucks against everything. Ryze always sucked vs low range, now he just sucks vs long range and short range.

I love Veigar and play him as one of my regular midlaners and I was a little (very) pissed about the rework. They took an itemization change (RIP DFG) that hurt him as an opportunity to nerf him, which felt really shitty. He was in a bad spot after that, but they did eventually get onto fixing him I am ok with where they have left him now. He's not quite the same as before and probably a little weaker, but he is a lot healthier for the game. I would love for them to give him a bit more love, but I'd still call him a successful rework.

Zilean needed a rework because his bombs were toxic to deal with, though I don't think they went about it the right way. A Sion level rework seems far more appropriate for him and I hope they get around to something like that someday, but until then he's at least healthier for the game. He certainly needs buffs in his current state though. I would say that Ryze was the most deserving of those three of the rework. Ryze was a late game champ who would bully melees out of lane when strong, meaning he would always scale into late game. The data says he could use buffs certainly, but given his previous state Riot is probably hesitant to do that, and they are probably going to wait a patch or two before handing him buffs.
